definition: good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort

sentences.english: How to get along with emulative colleague?
sentences.chinese: 這樣跟好強的同事相處？

sentences.english: Ed's wife is a strong-minded woman and leads him around by the nose.
sentences.chinese: 以德的妻子是一個好強的女生，他什麼事都得聽她的。

sentences.english: He said he was competitive and feisty and he did not back down.
sentences.chinese: 他說他很有競爭力，很好強，而且不退縮。

sentences.english: But if Shen Fan has rejected the kindness of a friend.
sentences.chinese: 但是好強的沈凡卻拒絕了朋友的好意。

sentences.english: As tough as she is, she has never cried since 13.
sentences.chinese: 好強的她，從13歲後就再也沒哭過。

sentences.english: Not to be outdone she tried again .
And his determined and competitive spirit was already apparent at that young age.
sentences.chinese: 他的決心和好強在那麼小的年紀就已經顯露無遺。

definition: incoherent speech/to talk without rhyme or reason (idiom)
to take care of one's family
to like to look good in the eyes of others/sensitive about how one is regarded by others/proud
hard to deal with/hard to get along with
(coll.) presenting as unfriendly and blunt, but warm and tender inside (loanword from Japanese "tsundere")
to be disappointing/to fail to live up to expectations
